free_text.Learning outcomes: Intelligent Transportation systems (ITS) is intended to improve the efficiency of surface transportation systems by effective monitoring and driving assistance through advanced technologies in information processing, communication, sensors and actuators, and embedded control which can be deployed both on the vehicles as well as on the road infrastructure. [br/][br/]The goal of this course is to transmit to the student state-of-the art methods and tools and as well as current research topics in intelligent transportation systems. Lectures will be either spread out over a semester or clustered in one week, including a potential contribution given by a guest lecturer, changing at each iteration of the course.[br/][br/][br/]Students will be able to put in practice their knowledge in a course project supervised by at least one of the four labs involved in the course.[br/]
